description: repairAction:Attempt to access the VM via ssh. If able to login, check the status of the system and restart the platform service or reboot the VM to recover.
probableCause: VNF went from INS/MTCE to OOS state.
specificProblem: The VNF affected changed from an in-service (INS)/maintenance(MTCE) to out of service (OOS) state.
probableCause: VNF enters into maintenance state.
specificProblem: The VNF is starting up.
probableCause: VNF is fully operational in Active state.
specificProblem: VNF is fully operational in Active state. This alarm cancels alarm EID_CARD_OOS or Alarm EID_CARD_SWITCHOVER.
probableCause: VNF is fully operational in Standby state.
specificProblem: VNF is fully operational in Standby state. This alarm cancels alarm EID_CARD_OOS or Alarm EID_CARD_SWITCHOVER.
repairAction:Check the status of the VMs that are in the protection group.If the VMs are down, reboot the VMs or restart the application service on those VMs to bring them INS.
probableCause: Protection group is in OOS state.
specificProblem: All VNFs belong to the same protection group are OOS, group is not operational.
specificProblem: Protection group is operational. One VNF as a minimum is active. Cancels previous alarm EID_PROTECTION_OOS.
repairAction:Restart IMS service on the peer or reboot the peer.
probableCause: The network between two VNFs has problems or the active side has hardware or software issues.
specificProblem: The active VNF does not respond to keep alive messages, so standby VNF takes over active VNF.
specificProblem: all component enter into inservice state
specificProblem: system minimum component enter into active
specificProblem: system active side enter into inservice
repairAction:Login into the SAS array via the management interface and check the status of the system.If unable to connect to the system, check cabling and power status.
specificProblem:SAS Array has issues. This alarm can be cleared by manual intervention only.
repairAction:Check if network cable is loose, or restart the terminal server.
probableCause:The network between AM and terminal server have issues or the terminal server has hardware/software issues.
specificProblem:The terminal server failed to respond to Keep-Alive messages
specificProblem:The terminal server is successfully respond to Keep-Alive messages.
specificProblem:This alarm is raised on Standby DB server only (not on ADM) when local MySQL DB is down.
repairAction:Check whether the database is running on the node. If not running, restart the system or start the database manually.

repairAction:Check network connectivity between the AM and the VM which shows the ping loss.Check the system for overload conditions, network issues, dropped packets and Linux network interface failures.
probableCause:network is resuming. Clears the EID_PING_LOST alarm.
probableCause:System is receiving SNMP Heart Beat Message.
specificProblem: System is receiving SNMP Heart Beat Message.
specificProblem: VNF enter into INITIALIZING state
probableCause:VNF enter into NOT CONFIGURE state

repairAction:PM restarts the minor program automatically.
probableCause: Minor program has been terminated.
specificProblem: Minor program has been terminated (manually or due to internal reasons) system will try to restore it automatically
probableCause: Minor program has been restored automatically.
specificProblem: Minor program has been restored automatically. This alarm cancels EID_PROGRAM_MINOR_TERM

repairAction:Check the IMS logs for errors from the application and check the /data/storage/corefiles directory for corefiles.No manual recovery needed as platform will automatically restart the process.
specificProblem: Major program has been terminated (manually or due to internal reasons) action triggered the switchover
repairAction:Check the IMS logs for errors from the application.Restart the application service or reboot the VM to recover.
specificProblem: After number of attempts restoring terminated program, action has failed, system has triggered the switchover
probableCause: Major program has been restored.
specificProblem: Major program has been restored automatically. This alarm cancels EID_PROGRAM_MAJOR_TERM
repairAction:Check the system configuration database to verify whether the VM is still configured.
probableCause: VNF has been terminated by the operator.
specificProblem: VNF has been terminated by the operator.
probableCause: VNF has been instantiated by the operator.
specificProblem: VNF has been instantiated by the operator.
repairAction:Unlock the VM via the EMS GUI.
probableCause: Operators locked this component using command graceful_lock through EMS.
specificProblem:This is used for maintenance actions on a specific VNF.
repairAction:Unlock the VM via the EMS GUI.
probableCause: Operators locked this component using command forceful_lock through EMS.
specificProblem: The VNF is locked and not able to provide the service.
probableCause: The component has been unlocked.
probableCause: The component has been unlocked
repairAction:Login to the card via ssh and check the disk usage of the partition.Delete or transfer files from the partition to free up disk space for ongoing operations.
probableCause: Disk Usage of a critical partition has exceeded the maximum allowed threshold.
specificProblem:The Disk Usage of all partitions configured in the OvldDiskInfo for a VNF has exceeded the maximum allowed threshold.
probableCause: A thread can be hung for a number of different reasons, including a deadlock on a shared resource or an infinite loop.
specificProblem: This event is sent when PM detects a hung thread in a process. A hung thread means the thread is no longer able to process messages as normal.
repairAction: The process will be restarted automatically by PM to recover from the hung thread.
repairAction:Check system overload status,traffic KPIs and resource CPU and memory resource usage.Check the CPU usage of the process reporting the alarm.
probableCause:A always-on, fail-safe alarm that is raised whenever 95% of the maximum size of an MX-queue is exceeded.
probableCause: Cleared when queue size drops below 70% usage.
probableCause:PM rejects the request to lock the VNF.
specificProblem:Locking 2 ADM components in 1 Protection Group is not allowed.
probableCause:A lock request from the mView EMS system was dropped. The component was previously locked or within the locking period.
specificProblem: A lock request from the mView EMS system was dropped. The component was previously locked or within the locking period.
probableCause:The unlock request from EMS has been dropped. the component is already unlocked.
specificProblem: The unlock request from EMS has been dropped because the component is already unlocked.

probableCause:Use mount command to verify the file system is mounted via NFS.Check /var/log/messages file for NFS error logs.Manually mount the NFS configuration file or reboot the VM to retry mounting the file systems.
specificProblem:Timeout occurred while mounting the redundancy directory.
repairAction:Manually mount the NFS configuration file.
probableCause:PM finished mounting the NFS file system.
specificProblem:NFS Mount is done. This will clear Alarm EID_CARD_NFS_MOUNT_PROCESS_TIMEOUT.
repairAction:Check /var/log/messages file for NFS error logs.Manually unmount using the NFS configuration file.
probableCause:The NFS configuration file(/etc/exports) is not correct or OS errors here.
specificProblem:Timeout occurred while mounting the redundancy directory.
probableCause:PM finished unmounting the NFS file system.
specificProblem:NFS un-mount is done. This will clear Alarm EID_CARD_NFS_UNMOUNT_PROCESS_TIMEOUT.
specificProblem:This event is going to clear alarm EID_PROCESS_HUNG_THREAD_DETECTED
probableCause:Minor program has been restored successfully.
repairAction:Check permission settings on the file /var/run/mavenir/mnode-log-ipc-shm_5500 and set permisions to 644 if set to other setting.
specificProblem:Log subsystem initialization failed.Clear alram EID_LOG_SUBSYS_INIT_FAILED
repairAction:Check the CPU usage via the top command. Reboot the VM or restart the process (if non-critical) to recover.
probableCause:The thread is stuck in a tight loop or the number of incoming messages to the thread exceeds the capability of the thread to process.
specificProblem:The CPU usage of a thread in the process exceeds the configured threshold for the configured period of time.
probableCause:The thread is stuck in a tight loop or the number of incoming messages to the thread exceeds the capability of the thread to process.
specificProblem:The CPU usage a thread in the process has fallen below the configured threshold.
repairAction:Check the server hardware via iLo for CPU hardware faults.
probableCause: Cpu is faulty or not detected
specificProblem: Cpu status is either unknown(1), degraded(3), failed(4) or disabled(5).
probableCause: The cpu is functioning correctly
repairAction:Please check the disk for faults. Replace the disk if faulty.
probableCause: Disk is faulty or not detected
specificProblem: Disk status is either other(1), failed(3), notConfigured(4), badCable(5), missingWasOk(6), missingWasFailed(7), predictiveFailure(8), missingWasPredictive
probableCause: The disk is functioning correctly
repairAction:Check the NIC card for faults. Replace the card if faulty.
probableCause: Nic is faulty or not detected and connectivity lost
specificProblem: Nic status is either unknown(1), degraded(3) or failed(4).
repairAction:The nic is functioning correctly and connectivity has been restored.
probableCause: The nic is functioning correctly and connectivity has been restored
repairAction:Please check the memory board or cartridge or Riser bus for faultiness.
probableCause: Memory is faulty or not detected.
specificProblem: Nic status is either other(1), dimmEccError (3), unlockError(4), configError(5), busError(6), powerError(7), advancedEcc(8).
probableCause: The memory board is functioning correctly
specificProblem: Memory board status is noError(2).
repairAction:Check the IMS logs for errors reported from the ovldMon process on the VM.Restart the ovldMon process or restart the VM.
probableCause: OvldMgr does not receive any reports from ovldMonitor.
specificProblem: The Overload Monitor process on the VNF is not reporting status.
probableCause: The Overload Monitor process on the VNF has resumed reporting status.
specificProblem:Clear previous alarm EID_ OVLD_MONITOR_ NOT_REPORTING.

repairAction: Recheck the app_service_port configuration table
specificProblem:Port Bind Failure encountered in app_service_port configuration.
repairAction:Start the ntpd process or restart the VM
probableCause:The ntpd process exited or was not started at boot time due to misconfiguration or startup failure
specificProblem:The ntpd process is not running.

event.Summary: NTPD process exited or not started

description: probableCause:The ntpd process was started and is running
repairAction:Check and modify system level fd limits via ulimit/sysctl
probableCause:A process is leaking fds or a high system load condition exists
specificProblem:File descriptor usage is above 90 percent threshold of availalable file descriptors.

event.Summary: File descriptor usage is below its threshold
